page.title: 13COMMUNICATION IN AYLESBURY
page.content: We went to the {sorting office} for this category. Aylesbury was once a good place to have a sorting office because a main railway line went right through but now it isn't so efficient. 400 {postmen}, 12 sorting ladies and 26 postmen (high grade) are employed in the sorting office. Aylesbury's sorting office covers 350 sq. miles. The first 2 letters of Aylesbury's postcode are H.P. We also visited the {telephone exchange}. In the exchange there are 35 part time operators in the day and 20 at night. Each operator takes an average of 50 calls an hour. Although the operators receive 5 real emergency calls a day, they have hundreds of hoax emergency calls.
